awd_titl_txt: A Travel Grant Program for the 12th International           Biophysics Congress, to be held Amsterdam, The Netherlands, August 11-16, 1996
awd_abstract_narration: 9602144  Lester    12th International Biophysics Congress Travel Program    The International Union for Pure and Applied Biophysics will hold its General Assembly and 12th International Congress in Amsterdam, The Netherlands, on 11-16, August 1996.  It is proposed that the Biophysical Society administer a travel grant program offering a limited number of travel awards to qualified U.S. Scientists who may require such assistance, with preference to young investigators and invited participants.   The U.S. National Committee for the International Union of Pure and Applied Biophysics (USNC/IUPAB) of the National Academy of Sciences will distribute applications, and receive the completed applications.  Responsibility for screening travel grant applications will be vested in a Committee of the Biophysical Society chosen by the Council of the Society or its Executive Committee for a slate of candidates provided by USNC/IUPAB.  The Biophysical Society and the USNC/IUPAB feel that qualified U.S. scientists should be assisted to attend this Congress to facilitate exchange of recent significant developments and dissemination of biophysical research data long before it could appear in journal form.  In order to facilitate the maximum number of U.S. scientists in receiving travel awards, the Biophysical Society has agreed to manage this program without assessing an overhead charge.  %%%
org_div_long_name: Division of Molecular and Cellular Biosciences
